website_summaries.verdict: Basic cycling shorts that are suitable for beginners or those who dislike bibs.
pros: These shorts have minimal seams for improved comfort
The chamois has a nice pad but is still breathable
They have reflective elements for riding in the evening
Eco-friendly and made of recycled nylon
cons: Not as comfortable as bib shorts
Some complaints about the chamois quality

customer_reviews.title: Good shorts at a reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: These are my preferred bike shorts -- good quality at a not-crazy price. I have about 7 pairs, enough to ride every day and do laundry once a week. I've worn out two pairs of these, but they were about 5 years old, and had probably been worn and washed a couple hundred times, which seems like a reasonable lifespan.
customer_reviews.author: David Ripton

customer_reviews.title: These are very comfortable shorts and they fit well
customer_reviews.text: The chamis was a bit large and stiff at first, but I got used to it quick. These are very comfortable shorts and they fit well. I would say the length of the legs is a little shorter than I'm used to, and certainly shorter than the product image depicts. The cuff of the short is substantial (in a good way) and has a nice grippy band to keep them from creeping up your things when you ride. I use them for both XC MTB and road riding.
customer_reviews.author: L. Blace

customer_reviews.title: I've been extremely happy with them and recommend purchasing some form of biking ...
customer_reviews.text: I started biking around 9 months ago and these were my first pair of biking shorts when I bought them. I've been extremely happy with them and recommend purchasing some form of biking shorts to anyone who rides a lot. It makes the ride a lot more comfortable especially as I started riding more and more. I'm 6'5" 200lbs with a 33-34 waist and I purchased the Large. I commonly have a hard time finding clothing that fits my size well and these do fit well. I don't have any problems with them.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff K.

customer_reviews.title: These are very nice! Chamois fit is personal
customer_reviews.text: These are very nice! Chamois fit is personal, so I will not go into too much detail here, but it works great for me, and matches that of other Pearl shorts I have. The bottoms of the legs have a nice, wide (1" or maybe 1.25") rubberized band that holds them in place on my legs. The cut works well, and the weight is good (not so thin, feels like they will last a good while).
customer_reviews.author: Regular Guy 2000

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike shorts for my needs. Most of my rides are around an sixty to ninety minutes and these shorts are excellent. Good length, good support without being constrictive, and the added width of the leg band is more comfortable. The padding is sufficient without being intrusive or obstructive. Will buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: Saximo

customer_reviews.title: Sooo comfortable..
customer_reviews.text: Great for rides ~30-40 miles. Anything beyond that becomes uncomfortable. Very comfortable and fits perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Vimo

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars - Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Much better than my other shorts. Highly recommend. Very nice padding on the shorts, and rarely every slide down or up. I'm not a huge cyclist, but I do ride 15-20 miles per bike trip, and these seem to work very well for me. A little sore after each ride, but I can only imagine this happens regardless if you own the best shorts on the market. I've seen the price fluctuate on this product alot, so try to find it at a good price! (Below like $50)
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Inspiration from well-done wear.
customer_reviews.text: Great bike shorts. worth the money. As a test, I rode twice as far as normal, and never noticed the seat(which normally would bother me) nor was I ever bothered by the a sense of discomfort, as I did with my last (different) pair of shorts. Will probably buy another pair. They make me want to ride more often, longer.
customer_reviews.author: George Raynsford

customer_reviews.title: Great Biking Shorts
customer_reviews.text: Great biking shorts. I own 3 pairs of these now. I've done rides up to 100 miles in them and I'm happy with the comfort and fit. They're lightweight, and well made. I've had one pair for a couple years and they hold up very well through the laundry many times. I'm about 33 waist, and wear the medium. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: J. James

customer_reviews.title: It's a lot more comfortable to ride more than 25 or 30 miles now
customer_reviews.text: Really makes a difference! It's a lot more comfortable to ride more than 25 or 30 miles now! (And yes, since other people mentioned that one should wear them without underwear, I tried that and found that is correct - they do work better with no underwear under them)
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Osborn

customer_reviews.title: Great shorts
customer_reviews.text: Great shorts. I am 5'6" with fairly athletic build. I ordered a size medium and they fit as expected, tight but not too tight. They have been comfortable for rides up to 75 miles for me, but honestly after this distance nothing seems comfortable so I can't blame the shorts for that. The quality seems to be good for the price and I would not hesitate to purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: zvan23

customer_reviews.title: Very nice shorts at this price.
customer_reviews.text: Fine riding shorts at a great price. - FIT: I'm 5' 11" @155lb, Mediums fit well. Leg compression helps reduce fatigue. - TEMPS: from cool to very hot -- all good. - LEG CREEP: they creep up thighs a little during ride, though not bad. - PADDING: ample, though not bulky; great comfort. - PRICE: Most definitely worth it.

customer_reviews.title: I made the mistake of wearing these without washing them ...
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of wearing these without washing them first and got a severe contact dermatitis. Think they were lined with a powder or spray. Have read that some manufacturers use formaldehyde (known to cause contact dermatitis) for mold/mildew protection and wrinkle prevention. Not sure if this was it. I do not have a latex or rubber or spandex allergy. Please wash them several times before you wear them or buy something else. If I could give zero stars I would.

customer_reviews.title: My favors bike shorts.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get some riding shorts since I'd gotten a new gravel grinder and after a little research I learned this was a top rated one, especially for the price. As always I had my doubts (can you trust reviewers 😀) but have to say these are great! Comfortable for longer rides due to the padding (greater than 20 miles) and easy to clean up. I love them for any ride I'm doing because of this.

customer_reviews.title: Not just best for your buck, just the best. Period.
customer_reviews.text: Picked these up for a 120 mile ride and was pleasantly surprised. They hugged my butt like only Pearl Izumi does, I love the ergonomic bend of the shirts. Not a single hot spot or chafing, and even with temps in the 90s I stayed nice and cool, definitely breathable. Crashed at mile 110 going 20 mph, and even though my legs got bruised and beat up, not a single tear in the shorts! I've tried a number of cycling shorts, but I keep coming back to Pearl for their outstanding comfort, durability, and quality.
